meanings.definition: A mythical creature that is friendly and helpful.
meanings.sent1: The little shmoo always helped the villagers with their chores.
meanings.sent2: I wish I had a pet shmoo to keep me company.
meanings.sent3: The children believed the shmoo could grant wishes if you treated it kindly.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like that of a mythical shmoo, always ready to lend a hand.
meanings.sent5: The old stories spoke of a magical shmoo that brought joy wherever it went.

meanings.definition: To be extremely eager or enthusiastic.
meanings.sent1: She would always shmoo about going to the amusement park.
meanings.sent2: The fans would shmoo with excitement whenever their favorite band performed.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him for how he would shmoo over new video game releases.
meanings.sent4: The students would shmoo towards the finish line during the school race.
meanings.sent5: The puppy would shmoo with joy every time its owner came home.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily influenced or manipulated.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the office shmoo, always agreeing with whatever the boss said.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been a shmoo for believing everything she was told.
meanings.sent3: The salesman saw him as an easy target, a perfect shmoo for his pitch.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the villain used a young shmoo to carry out his evil plans.
meanings.sent5: She didn't want to be seen as a shmoo, so she started standing up for herself more.
